zodipy._components¶

class zodipy._components.Band(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, delta_zeta, v, p, delta_r)[source]¶

The Zodiacal Astroidal Band component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (Quantity[u.AU ** -1]) – Density at 3 AU.

  • delta_zeta (Quantity[u.deg] | Quantity[u.rad]) – Shape parameter [deg].

  • v (float) – Shape parameter.

  • p (float) – Shape parameter.

  • delta_r (Quantity[u.AU]) – Inner radial cutoff.

compute_density(X_helio, X_0_cloud, **_)[source]¶

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]

class zodipy._components.Cloud(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, alpha, beta, gamma, mu)[source]¶

The Zodiacal Diffuse Cloud component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (Quantity[u.AU ** -1]) – Density at 1 AU.

  • alpha (float) – Radial power-law exponent.

  • beta (float) – Vertical shape parameter.

  • gamma (float) – Vertical power-law exponent.

  • mu (float) – Widening parameter for the modified fan.

compute_density(X_helio, **_)[source]¶

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]

class zodipy._components.Component(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega)[source]¶

Base class for an Interplanetary Dust Component.

Any component that inherits from this class needs to implement the two abstract methods get_compcentric_coordinates and compute_density.

Parameters

  • x_0 (Quantity[u.AU]) – x-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates in AU.

  • y_0 (Quantity[u.AU]) – y-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates in AU.

  • z_0 (Quantity[u.AU]) – z-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates in AU.

  • i (Quantity[u.deg] | Quantity[u.rad]) – Inclination with respect to the ecliptic planein deg.

  • Omega (Quantity[u.deg] | Quantity[u.rad]) – Ascending node in deg.

abstract compute_density(X_helio, *, X_earth=None, X_0_cloud=None)[source]¶

Returns the dust density of a component at points in the Solar System given by ‘X_helio’.

Parameters

  • X_helio (ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]) – Heliocentric ecliptic coordinates (x, y, z) of points in the Solar System.

  • X_earth (Optional[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]]) – Heliocentric ecliptic coordinates of the Earth. Required for the Earth-trailing Feature-

  • X_0_cloud (Optional[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]]) – Heliocentric ecliptic coordinates of the Diffuse Clouds offset. Required for the Dust Bands.

Return type

Density of the component at points in the Solar System.

class zodipy._components.Feature(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, R, sigma_r, sigma_z, theta, sigma_theta)[source]¶

The Zodiacal Earth-trailing Feature component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (Quantity[u.AU ** -1]) – Density at 1 AU.

  • R (Quantity[u.AU]) – Radius of the peak density.

  • sigma_r (Quantity[u.AU]) – Radial dispersion.

  • sigma_z (Quantity[u.AU]) – Vertical dispersion.

  • θ – Longitude with respect to Earth.

  • sigma_θ – Longitude dispersion.

compute_density(X_helio, X_earth, **_)[source]¶

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]

The Zodiacal Circum-solar Ring component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (Quantity[u.AU ** -1]) – Density at 1 AU.

  • R (Quantity[u.AU]) – Radius of the peak density.

  • sigma_r (Quantity[u.AU]) – Radial dispersion.

  • sigma_z (Quantity[u.AU]) – Vertical dispersion.
